text: The beginning of the good news of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As it is written in the prophet Isaiah,
“See, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    who will prepare your way,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: so John the baptizer appeared in the wilderness, proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole Judean region and all the people of Jerusalem were going out to him and were baptized by him in the River Jordan, confessing their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now John was clothed with camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: He proclaimed, “The one who is more powerful than I is coming after me; I am not worthy to stoop down and untie the strap of his sandals.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And just as he was coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens torn apart and the Spirit descending like a dove upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a voice came from the heavens, “You are my Son, the Beloved; with you I am well pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit immediately drove him out into the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the wilderness forty days, tested by Satan, and he was with the wild beasts, and the angels waited on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after John was arrested, Jesus came to Galilee proclaiming the good news of God
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God has come near; repent, and believe in the good news.”
speaker: Jesus

text: As Jesus passed along the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the sea, for they were fishers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Follow me, and I will make you fishers of people.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And immediately they left their nets and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he went a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John, who were in their boat mending the nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, he entered the synagogue and taught.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were astounded at his teaching, for he taught them as one having authority and not as the scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he cried out, “What have you to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are, the Holy One of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet and come out of him!”
speaker: Jesus

text: And the unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all amazed, and they kept on asking one another, “What is this? A new teaching—with authority! He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At once his fame began to spread throughout the surrounding region of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as they left the synagogue, they entered the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and they told him about her at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up. Then the fever left her, and she began to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: That evening, at sunset, they brought to him all who were sick or possessed by demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole city was gathered around the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cured many who were sick with various diseases and cast out many demons, and he would not permit the demons to speak, because they knew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning, while it was still very dark, he got up and went out to a deserted place, and there he prayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simon and his companions hunted for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they found him, they said to him, “Everyone is searching for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Let us go on to the neighboring towns, so that I may proclaim the message there also, for that is what I came out to do.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he went throughout all Galilee, proclaiming the message in their synagogues and casting out demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man with a skin disease came to him begging him, and kneeling he said to him, “If you are willing, you can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moved with pity, Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him and said to him, “I am willing. Be made clean!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Immediately the skin disease left him, and he was made clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: After sternly warning him he sent him away at once,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But he went out and began to proclaim it freely and to spread the word, so that Jesus could no longer go into a town openly but stayed out in the country, and people came to him from every quarter.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he returned to Capernaum after some days, it was reported that he was at home.
speaker: Narrator

text: So many gathered around that there was no longer room for them, not even in front of the door, and he was speaking the word to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some people came, bringing to him a paralyzed man, carried by four of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they could not bring him to Jesus because of the crowd, they removed the roof above him, and after having dug through it, they let down the mat on which the paralytic lay.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Child, your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now some of the scribes were sitting there questioning in their hearts,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why does this fellow speak in this way? It is blasphemy! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
speaker: Narrator

text: At once Jesus perceived in his spirit that they were discussing these questions among themselves, and he said to them, “Why do you raise such questions in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which is easier: to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and take your mat and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic—
speaker: Jesus

text: “I say to you, stand up, take your mat, and go to your home.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he stood up and immediately took the mat and went out before all of them, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went out again beside the sea; the whole crowd gathered around him, and he taught them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was walking along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax-collection station, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he got up and followed him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And as he sat at dinner in Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were also sitting with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the scribes of the Pharisees saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, they said to his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, he said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician but those who are sick; I have not come to call the righteous but sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and people came and said to him, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “The wedding attendants cannot fast while the bridegroom is with them, can they? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast on that day.
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old cloak; otherwise, the patch pulls away from it, the new from the old, and a worse tear is made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Similarly, no one puts new wine into old wineskins; otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and the wine is lost, and so are the skins, but one puts new wine into fresh wineskins.”
speaker: Jesus

text: One Sabbath he was going through the grain fields, and as they made their way his disciples began to pluck heads of grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need of food,
speaker: Jesus

text: how he entered the house of God when Abiathar was high priest and ate the bread of the Presence, which it is not lawful for any but the priests to eat, and he gave some to his companions?”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for humankind and not humankind for the Sabbath,
speaker: Jesus

text: so the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Again he entered the synagogue, and a man was there who had a withered hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were watching him to see whether he would cure him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Come forward.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “Is it lawful to do good or to do harm on the Sabbath, to save life or to kill?” But they were silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: He looked around at them with anger; he was grieved at their hardness of heart and said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees went out and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how to destroy him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus departed with his disciples to the sea, and a great multitude from Galilee followed him;
speaker: Narrator

text: hearing all that he was doing, they came to him in great numbers from Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, beyond the Jordan, and the region around Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told his disciples to have a boat ready for him because of the crowd, so that they would not crush him,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had cured many, so that all who had diseases pressed upon him to touch him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down before him and shouted, “You are the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he sternly ordered them not to make him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went up the mountain and called to him those whom he wanted, and they came to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he appointed twelve to be with him and to be sent out to preach
speaker: Narrator

text: and to have authority to cast out demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he appointed the twelve: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter),
speaker: Narrator

text: James son of Zebedee and John the brother of James (to whom he gave the name Boanerges, that is, Sons of Thunder),
speaker: Narrator

text: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Cananaean,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judas Iscariot, who handed him over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went home, and the crowd came together again, so that they could not even eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his family heard it, they went out to restrain him, for people were saying, “He has gone out of his mind.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebul, and by the ruler of the demons he casts out demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called them to him and spoke to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
speaker: Narrator

text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but his end has come.
speaker: Narrator

text: But no one can enter a strong man’s house and plunder his property without first tying up the strong man; then indeed the house can be plundered.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Truly I tell you, people will be forgiven for their sins and whatever blasphemies they utter,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit can never have forgiveness but is guilty of an eternal sin”—
speaker: Narrator

text: for they had said, “He has an unclean spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his mother and his brothers came, and standing outside they sent to him and called him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A crowd was sitting around him, and they said to him, “Your mother and your brothers are outside asking for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he replied, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And looking at those who sat around him, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever does the will of God is my brother and sister and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he began to teach beside the sea. Such a very large crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat on the sea and sat there, while the whole crowd was beside the sea on the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: He began to teach them many things in parables, and in his teaching he said to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he sowed, some seed fell on a path, and the birds came and ate it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell on rocky ground, where it did not have much soil, and it sprang up quickly, since it had no depth of soil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sun rose, it was scorched, and since it had no root it withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell into good soil and brought forth grain, growing up and increasing and yielding thirty and sixty and a hundredfold.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “If you have ears to hear, then hear!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he was alone, those who were around him along with the twelve asked him about the parables.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “To you has been given the secret of the kingdom of God, but for those outside everything comes in parables,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in order that
‘they may indeed look but not perceive,
    and may indeed hear but not understand;
so that they may not turn again and be forgiven.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? Then how will you understand all the parables?
speaker: Narrator

text: The sower sows the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones on the path where the word is sown: when they hear, Satan immediately comes and takes away the word that is sown in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the ones sown on rocky ground: when they hear the word, they immediately receive it with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they have no root and endure only for a while; then, when trouble or persecution arises on account of the word, immediately they fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And others are those sown among the thorns: these are the ones who hear the word,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the cares of the age and the lure of wealth and the desire for other things come in and choke the word, and it yields nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the ones sown on the good soil: they hear the word and accept it and bear fruit, thirty and sixty and a hundredfold.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Is a lamp brought in to be put under the bushel basket or under the bed and not on the lampstand?
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is nothing hidden, except to be disclosed; nor is anything secret, except to come to light.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you have ears to hear, then hear!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Pay attention to what you hear; the measure you give will be the measure you get, and it will be added to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to those who have, more will be given, and from those who have nothing, even what they have will be taken away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He also said, “The kingdom of God is as if someone would scatter seed on the ground
speaker: Narrator

text: and would sleep and rise night and day, and the seed would sprout and grow, he does not know how.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth produces of itself first the stalk, then the head, then the full grain in the head.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the grain is ripe, at once he goes in with his sickle because the harvest has come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He also said, “With what can we compare the kingdom of God, or what parable will we use for it?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a mustard seed, which, when sown upon the ground, is the smallest of all the seeds on earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet when it is sown it grows up and becomes the greatest of all shrubs and puts forth large branches, so that the birds of the air can make nests in its shade.”
speaker: Narrator

text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it;
speaker: Narrator

text: he did not speak to them except in parables, but he explained everything in private to his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them, “Let us go across to the other side.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And leaving the crowd behind, they took him with them in the boat, just as he was. Other boats were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A great windstorm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so that the boat was already being swamped.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up and said to him, “Teacher, do you not care that we are perishing?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And waking up, he rebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Be silent! Be still!” Then the wind ceased, and there was a dead calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Why are you afraid? Have you still no faith?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were filled with great fear and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to the other side of the sea, to the region of the Gerasenes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had stepped out of the boat, immediately a man from the tombs with an unclean spirit met him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lived among the tombs, and no one could restrain him any more, even with a chain,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had often been restrained with shackles and chains, but the chains he wrenched apart, and the shackles he broke in pieces, and no one had the strength to subdue him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Night and day among the tombs and on the mountains he was always howling and bruising himself with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and bowed down before him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he shouted at the top of his voice, “What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, do not torment me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he had said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He replied, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He begged him earnestly not to send them out of the region.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there on the hillside a great herd of swine was feeding,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the unclean spirits begged him, “Send us into the swine; let us enter them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he gave them permission. And the unclean spirits came out and entered the swine, and the herd, numbering about two thousand, stampeded down the steep bank into the sea and were drowned in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The swineherds ran off and told it in the city and in the country. Then people came to see what it was that had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Jesus and saw the man possessed by demons sitting there, clothed and in his right mind, the very man who had had the legion, and they became frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had seen what had happened to the man possessed by demons and to the swine reported it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they began to beg Jesus to leave their neighborhood.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was getting into the boat, the man who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus refused and said to him, “Go home to your own people, and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and what mercy he has shown you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him, and everyone was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had crossed again in the boat to the other side, a great crowd gathered around him, and he was by the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then one of the leaders of the synagogue, named Jairus, came and, when he saw him, fell at his feet
speaker: Narrator

text: and pleaded with him repeatedly, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Come and lay your hands on her, so that she may be made well and live.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he went with him.
And a large crowd followed him and pressed in on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a woman who had been suffering from a flow of blood for twelve years.
speaker: Narrator

text: She had endured much under many physicians and had spent all that she had, and she was no better but rather grew worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: She had heard about Jesus and came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,
speaker: Narrator

text: for she said, “If I but touch his cloak, I will be made well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately her flow of blood stopped, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her disease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately aware that power had gone forth from him, Jesus turned about in the crowd and said, “Who touched my cloak?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And his disciples said to him, “You see the crowd pressing in on you; how can you say, ‘Who touched me?’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: He looked all around to see who had done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came in fear and trembling, fell down before him, and told him the whole truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace, and be healed of your disease.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, some people came from the synagogue leader’s house to say, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the teacher any further?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But overhearing what they said, Jesus said to the synagogue leader, “Do not be afraid; only believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He allowed no one to follow him except Peter, James, and John, the brother of James.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the synagogue leader’s house, he saw a commotion, people weeping and wailing loudly.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had entered, he said to them, “Why do you make a commotion and weep? The child is not dead but sleeping.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laughed at him. Then he put them all outside and took the child’s father and mother and those who were with him and went in where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking her by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha koum,” which means, “Little girl, get up!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately the girl stood up and began to walk about (she was twelve years of age). At this they were overcome with amazement.
speaker: Narrator

text: He strictly ordered them that no one should know this and told them to give her something to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left that place and came to his hometown, and his disciples followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the Sabbath he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were astounded. They said, “Where did this man get all this? What is this wisdom that has been given to him? What deeds of power are being done by his hands!
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon, and are not his sisters here with us?” And they took offense at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “Prophets are not without honor, except in their hometown and among their own kin and in their own house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he could do no deed of power there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people and cured them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he was amazed at their unbelief.
Then he went about among the villages teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: He called the twelve and began to send them out two by two and gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
speaker: Narrator

text: He ordered them to take nothing for their journey except a staff: no bread, no bag, no money in their belts,
speaker: Narrator

text: but to wear sandals and not to put on two tunics.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, stay there until you leave the place.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any place will not welcome you and they refuse to hear you, as you leave, shake off the dust that is on your feet as a testimony against them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went out and proclaimed that all should repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cast out many demons and anointed with oil many who were sick and cured them.
speaker: Narrator

text: King Herod heard of it, for Jesus’s name had become known. Some were saying, “John the baptizer has been raised from the dead, and for this reason these powers are at work in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But others said, “It is Elijah.” And others said, “It is a prophet, like one of the prophets of old.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod heard of it, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod himself had sent men who arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, because Herod had married her.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John had been telling Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Herodias had a grudge against him and wanted to kill him. But she could not,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and he protected him. When he heard him, he was greatly perplexed, and yet he liked to listen to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But an opportunity came when Herod on his birthday gave a banquet for his courtiers and officers and for the leaders of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his daughter Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his guests, and the king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you wish, and I will give it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he swore to her, “Whatever you ask me, I will give you, even half of my kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She went out and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?” She replied, “The head of John the baptizer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately she rushed back to the king and requested, “I want you to give me at once the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The king was deeply grieved, yet out of regard for his oaths and for the guests, he did not want to refuse her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately the king sent a soldier of the guard with orders to bring John’s head. He went and beheaded him in the prison,
speaker: Narrator

text: brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl. Then the girl gave it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the following day, when they came from Bethany, he was hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to see whether perhaps he would find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And his disciples heard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they came to Jerusalem. And he entered the temple and began to drive out those who were selling and those who were buying in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he would not allow anyone to carry anything through the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was teaching and saying, “Is it not written,
‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations’?
    But you have made it a den of robbers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the chief priests and the scribes heard it, they kept looking for a way to kill him, for they were afraid of him because the whole crowd was spellbound by his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when evening came, Jesus and his disciples went out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning as they passed by, they saw the fig tree withered away to its roots.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter remembered and said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree that you cursed has withered.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I tell you, if you say to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and thrown into the sea,’ and if you do not doubt in your heart but believe that what you say will come to pass, it will be done for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your trespasses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again they came to Jerusalem. As he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came to him
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “By what authority are you doing these things? Who gave you this authority to do them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question; answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did the baptism of John come from heaven, or was it of human origin? Answer me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They argued with one another, “What should we say? If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But shall we say, ‘Of human origin’?”—they were afraid of the crowd, for all regarded John as truly a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they answered Jesus, “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, put a fence around it, dug a pit for the winepress, and built a watchtower; then he leased it to tenants and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the season came, he sent a slave to the tenants to collect from them his share of the produce of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they seized him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he sent another slave to them; this one they beat over the head and insulted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he sent another, and that one they killed. And so it was with many others; some they beat, and others they killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had still one other, a beloved son. Finally he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But those tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So they seized him, killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the tenants and give the vineyard to others.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
this was the Lord’s doing,
    and it is amazing in our eyes’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they realized that he had told this parable against them, they wanted to arrest him, but they feared the crowd. So they left him and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they sent to him some Pharisees and some Herodians to trap him in what he said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came and said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are sincere and show deference to no one, for you do not regard people with partiality but teach the way of God in accordance with truth. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not?
speaker: Narrator

text: Should we pay them, or should we not?” But knowing their hypocrisy, he said to them, “Why are you putting me to the test? Bring me a denarius and let me see it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought one. Then he said to them, “Whose head is this and whose title?” They answered, “Caesar’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were utterly amazed at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him and asked him a question, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies, leaving a wife but no child, the man shall marry the widow and raise up children for his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were seven brothers; the first married and, when he died, left no children,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the second married the widow and died, leaving no children, and the third likewise;
speaker: Narrator

text: none of the seven left children. Last of all the woman herself died.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be? For all seven had married her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Is not this the reason you are wrong, that you know neither the scriptures nor the power of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: For when people rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like angels in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the story about the bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is God not of the dead but of the living; you are quite wrong.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the scribes came near and heard them disputing with one another, and seeing that he answered them well he asked him, “Which commandment is the first of all?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “The first is, ‘Hear, O Israel: the Lord our God, the Lord is one;
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The second is this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the scribe said to him, “You are right, Teacher; you have truly said that ‘he is one, and besides him there is no other’;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ‘to love him with all the heart and with all the understanding and with all the strength’ and ‘to love one’s neighbor as oneself’—this is much more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” After that no one dared to ask him any question.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Jesus was teaching in the temple, he said, “How can the scribes say that the Messiah is the son of David?
speaker: Narrator

text:
David himself, by the Holy Spirit, declared,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at my right hand,
    until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’
speaker: Narrator

text: “David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?” And the large crowd was listening to him with delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he taught, he said, “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk around in long robes and to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces
speaker: Narrator

text: and to have the best seats in the synagogues and places of honor at banquets!
speaker: Narrator

text: They devour widows’ houses and for the sake of appearance say long prayers. They will receive the greater condemnation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He sat down opposite the treasury and watched the crowd putting money into the treasury. Many rich people put in large sums.
speaker: Narrator

text: A poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which are worth a penny.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called his disciples and said to them, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put in more than all those who are contributing to the treasury.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all of them have contributed out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty has put in everything she had, all she had to live on.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he came out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Look, Teacher, what large stones and what large buildings!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus asked him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left here upon another; all will be thrown down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell us, when will this be, and what will be the sign that all these things are about to be accomplished?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus began to say to them, “Beware that no one leads you astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many will come in my name and say, ‘I am he!’ and they will lead many astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed; this must take place, but the end is still to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom; there will be earthquakes in various places; there will be famines. This is but the beginning of the birth pangs.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for yourselves, beware, for they will hand you over to councils, and you will be beaten in synagogues, and you will stand before governors and kings because of me, as a testimony to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the good news must first be proclaimed to all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they bring you to trial and hand you over, do not worry beforehand about what you are to say, but say whatever is given you at that time, for it is not you who speak but the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sibling will betray sibling to death and a father his child, and children will rise against parents and have them put to death,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will be hated by all because of my name. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But when you see the desolating sacrilege set up where it ought not to be (let the reader understand), then those in Judea must flee to the mountains;
speaker: Narrator

text: the one on the housetop must not go down or enter to take anything from the house;
speaker: Narrator

text: the one in the field must not turn back to get a coat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing infants in those days!
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray that it may not be in winter.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in those days there will be suffering, such as has not been from the beginning of the creation that God created until now and never will be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would be saved, but for the sake of the elect, whom he chose, he has cut short those days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if anyone says to you at that time, ‘Look! Here is the Messiah!’ or ‘Look! There he is!’—do not believe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: False messiahs and false prophets will appear and produce signs and wonders, to lead astray, if possible, the elect.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be alert; I have already told you everything.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But in those days, after that suffering,
the sun will be darkened,
    and the moon will not give its light,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and the stars will be falling from heaven,
    and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then they will see ‘the Son of Man coming in clouds’ with great power and glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he will send out the angels and gather the elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “From the fig tree learn its lesson: as soon as its branch becomes tender and puts forth its leaves, you know that summer is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So also, when you see these things taking place, you know that he is near, at the very gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all these things have taken place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But about that day or hour no one knows, neither the angels in heaven nor the Son, but only the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware, keep alert, for you do not know when the time will come.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a man going on a journey, when he leaves home and puts his slaves in charge, each with his work, and commands the doorkeeper to be on the watch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, keep awake, for you do not know when the master of the house will come, in the evening or at midnight or at cockcrow or at dawn,
speaker: Narrator

text: or else he may find you asleep when he comes suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what I say to you I say to all: Keep awake.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It was two days before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The chief priests and the scribes were looking for a way to arrest Jesus by stealth and kill him,
speaker: Narrator

text: for they said, “Not during the festival, or there may be a riot among the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very costly ointment of nard, and she broke open the jar and poured the ointment on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some were there who said to one another in anger, “Why was the ointment wasted in this way?
speaker: Narrator

text: For this ointment could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and the money given to the poor.” And they scolded her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “Let her alone; why do you trouble her? She has performed a good service for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you always have the poor with you, and you can show kindness to them whenever you wish, but you will not always have me.
speaker: Narrator

text: She has done what she could; she has anointed my body beforehand for its burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I tell you, wherever the good news is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will be told in remembrance of her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests in order to betray him to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard it, they were greatly pleased and promised to give him money. So he began to look for an opportunity to betray him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb is sacrificed, his disciples said to him, “Where do you want us to go and make the preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he sent two of his disciples, saying to them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you; follow him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and wherever he enters, say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is my guest room where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
speaker: Narrator

text: He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples set out and went to the city and found everything as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover meal.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, he came with the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had taken their places and were eating, Jesus said, “Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me, one who is eating with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They began to be distressed and to say to him one after another, “Surely, not I?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “It is one of the twelve, one who is dipping bread into the bowl with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man goes as it is written of him, but woe to that one by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that one not to have been born.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were eating, he took a loaf of bread, and after blessing it he broke it, gave it to them, and said, “Take; this is my body.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks he gave it to them, and all of them drank from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I tell you, I will never again drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had sung the hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away, for it is written,
‘I will strike the shepherd,
    and the sheep will be scattered.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But after I am raised up, I will go before you to Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Even though all fall away, I will not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Truly I tell you, this day, this very night, before the cock crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said vehemently, “Even though I must die with you, I will not deny you.” And all of them said the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He took with him Peter and James and John and began to be distressed and agitated.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, even to death; remain here, and keep awake.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And going a little farther, he threw himself on the ground and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Abba, Father, for you all things are possible; remove this cup from me, yet not what I want but what you want.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He came and found them sleeping, and he said to Peter, “Simon, are you asleep? Could you not keep awake one hour?
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep awake and pray that you may not come into the time of trial; the spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he went away and prayed, saying the same words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And once more he came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they did not know what to say to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came a third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? Enough! The hour has come; the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get up, let us be going. Look, my betrayer is at hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived, and with him there was a crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I will kiss is the man; arrest him and lead him away under guard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when he came, he went up to him at once and said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they laid hands on him and arrested him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of those who stood near drew his sword and struck the slave of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest me as though I were a rebel?
speaker: Narrator

text: Day after day I was with you in the temple teaching, and you did not arrest me. But let the scriptures be fulfilled.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them deserted him and fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: A certain young man was following him, wearing nothing but a linen cloth. They caught hold of him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he left the linen cloth and ran off naked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes were assembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter had followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest, and he was sitting with the guards, warming himself at the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the chief priests and the whole council were looking for testimony against Jesus to put him to death, but they found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony did not agree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some stood up and gave false testimony against him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another, not made with hands.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: But even on this point their testimony did not agree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is it that they testify against you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he was silent and did not answer. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said, “I am, and
‘you will see the Son of Man
seated at the right hand of the Power’
and ‘coming with the clouds of heaven.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, “Why do we still need witnesses?
speaker: Narrator

text: You have heard his blasphemy! What is your decision?” All of them condemned him as deserving death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some began to spit on him, to blindfold him, and to strike him, saying to him, “Prophesy!” The guards also took him and beat him.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the female servants of the high priest came by.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she saw Peter warming himself, she stared at him and said, “You also were with Jesus, the man from Nazareth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it, saying, “I do not know or understand what you are talking about.” And he went out into the forecourt. Then the cock crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the female servant, on seeing him, began again to say to the bystanders, “This man is one of them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But again he denied it. Then after a little while the bystanders again said to Peter, “Certainly you are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and you talk like one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he began to curse, and he swore an oath, “I do not know this man you are talking about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that moment the cock crowed for the second time. Then Peter remembered that Jesus had said to him, “Before the cock crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as it was morning, the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council. They bound Jesus, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered him, “You say so.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chief priests accused him of many things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate asked him again, “Have you no answer? See how many charges they bring against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus made no further reply, so that Pilate was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at the festival he used to release a prisoner for them, anyone for whom they asked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a man called Barabbas was in prison with the insurrectionists who had committed murder during the insurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the crowd came and began to ask Pilate to do for them according to his custom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he answered them, “Do you want me to release for you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he realized that it was out of jealousy that the chief priests had handed him over.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have him release Barabbas for them instead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate spoke to them again, “Then what do you wish me to do with the man you call the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They shouted back, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate asked them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they shouted all the more, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate, wishing to satisfy the crowd, released Barabbas for them, and after flogging Jesus he handed him over to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the soldiers led him into the courtyard of the palace (that is, the governor’s headquarters), and they called together the whole cohort.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they clothed him in a purple cloak, and after twisting some thorns into a crown they put it on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began saluting him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They struck his head with a reed, spat upon him, and knelt down in homage to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After mocking him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They compelled a passer-by, who was coming in from the country, to carry his cross; it was Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha (which means Place of a Skull).
speaker: Narrator

text: And they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they crucified him and divided his clothes among them, casting lots to decide what each should take.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was nine o’clock in the morning when they crucified him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inscription of the charge against him read, “The King of the Jews.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And with him they crucified two rebels, one on his right and one on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who passed by derided him, shaking their heads and saying, “Aha! You who would destroy the temple and build it in three days,
speaker: Narrator

text: save yourself, and come down from the cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way the chief priests, along with the scribes, were also mocking him among themselves and saying, “He saved others; he cannot save himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the Messiah, the King of Israel, come down from the cross now, so that we may see and believe.” Those who were crucified with him also taunted him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
speaker: Narrator

text: At three o’clock Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When some of the bystanders heard it, they said, “Listen, he is calling for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And someone ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Wait, let us see whether Elijah will come to take him down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus gave a loud cry and breathed his last.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the curtain of the temple was torn in two, from top to bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the centurion who stood facing him saw that in this way he breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was God’s Son!”
speaker: Narrator

text: There were also women looking on from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome,
speaker: Narrator

text: who followed him when he was in Galilee and ministered to him, and there were many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening had come, and since it was the day of Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph of Arimathea, a respected member of the council who was also himself waiting expectantly for the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate wondered if he were already dead, and summoning the centurion he asked him whether he had been dead for some time.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he learned from the centurion that he was dead, he granted the body to Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph bought a linen cloth and, taking down the body, wrapped it in the linen cloth and laid it in a tomb that had been hewn out of rock. He then rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where the body was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James and Salome bought spices, so that they might go and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And very early on the first day of the week, when the sun had risen, they went to the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had been saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance to the tomb?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had already been rolled back.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “Do not be alarmed; you are looking for Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He has been raised; he is not here. Look, there is the place they laid him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter that he is going ahead of you to Galilee; there you will see him, just as he told you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they went out and fled from the tomb, for terror and amazement had seized them, and they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.
And all that had been commanded them they told briefly to those around Peter. And afterward Jesus himself sent out through them, from east to west, the sacred and imperishable proclamation of eternal salvation. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after he rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: She went out and told those who had been with him, while they were mourning and weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they would not believe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this he appeared in another form to two of them, as they were walking into the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went back and told the rest, but they did not believe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later he appeared to the eleven themselves as they were sitting at the table, and he upbraided them for their lack of faith and stubbornness, because they had not believed those who saw him after he had risen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Go into all the world and proclaim the good news to the whole creation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who believes and is baptized will be saved, but the one who does not believe will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these signs will accompany those who believe: by using my name they will cast out demons; they will speak in new tongues;
speaker: Narrator

text: they will pick up snakes, and if they drink any deadly thing, it will not hurt them; they will lay their hands on the sick, and they will recover.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went out and proclaimed the good news everywhere, while the Lord worked with them and confirmed the message by the signs that accompanied it.
speaker: Narrator
